{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ceramide is a lipid molecule that is composed of sphingosine and a fatty acid, as mentioned in Document [2]. It is not a simple lipid because it is composed of more than one type of molecule. It is not a precursor lipid because it is not used to form other lipids, but rather it is formed from other molecules. It is not a derived lipid because it is not formed from the breakdown of other lipids.
